name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $url
desc: Returns: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this condition definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the condition definition is stored on different servers.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An absolute URI that is used to identify this condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at whi

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: A formal identifier that is used to identify this condition definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $addidentifier
desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this condition definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A formal identifier that is used to identify this condition definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

name: $::version
desc: Returns: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the condition definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the condition definition author and is not expected to be globally

name: $::name
desc: Returns: A natural language name identifying the condition definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A natural language name identifying the condition definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

name: $title
desc: Returns: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the condition definition.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the condition definition.

name: $subtitle
desc: Returns: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: An explanatory or alternate title for the event definition giving additional information about its content.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The status of this condition definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

name: $experimental
desc: Returns: A Boolean value to indicate that this condition definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A Boolean value to indicate that this condition definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

name: $date
desc: Returns: The date  (and optionally time) when the condition definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition definition changes.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The date  (and optionally time) when the condition definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the condition

name: $publisher
desc: Returns: The name of the organization or individual that published the condition definition.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The name of the organization or individual that published the condition definition.

name: $contact
desc: Returns: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $addcontact
desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

name: $description
desc: Returns: A free text natural language description of the condition definition from a consumer's perspective.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A free text natural language description of the condition definition from a consumer's perspective.

name: $useContext
desc: Returns: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate condition definition instances.

name: $adduseContext
desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate condition definition instances.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist w

name: $jurisdiction
desc: Returns: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

name: $addjurisdiction
desc: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A legal or geographic region in which the condition definition is intended to be used.

name: $code
desc: Returns: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

name: $severity
desc: Returns: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

name: $bodySite
desc: Returns: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

name: $stage
desc: Returns: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

name: $hasSeverity
desc: Returns: Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Whether Severity is appropriate to collect for this condition.

name: $hasBodySite
desc: Returns: Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Whether bodySite is appropriate to collect for this condition.

name: $hasStage
desc: Returns: Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Whether stage is appropriate to collect for this condition.

name: $definition
desc: Returns: Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

name: $adddefinition
desc: Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Formal definitions of the condition. These may be references to ontologies, published clinical protocols or research papers.

name: $observation
desc: Returns: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

name: $addobservation
desc: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Observations particularly relevant to this condition.

name: $medication
desc: Returns: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

name: $addmedication
desc: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Medications particularly relevant for this condition.

name: $precondition
desc: Returns: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

name: $addprecondition
desc: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An observation that suggests that this condition applies.

name: $team
desc: Returns: Appropriate team for this condition.

name: $addteam
desc: Appropriate team for this condition.

name: $questionnaire
desc: Returns: Questionnaire for this condition.

name: $addquestionnaire
desc: Questionnaire for this condition.

name: $plan
desc: Returns: Plan that is appropriate.

name: $addplan
desc: Plan that is appropriate.
